diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Perforated gangrenous appendicitis, GNR bacteremia, GNR peritonitis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with midepigastric pain, worsening to right lower quadrant (RLQ) pain with sweating and increased abdominal pain, leading to a diagnosis of perforated gangrenous appendicitis. CT imaging indicated a fluid-filled and dilated appendix, and the presence of free fluid with peritoneal enhancement, supporting the diagnosis of GNR peritonitis and bacteremia.
